This should now be fixed. I've tested against Joshua's server. The problem (at lest in Joshua's case) appears to be lack of support for  cookies in multiple request headers. Once 'http.protocol.single-cookie-header' was set true on HttpClient everything worked. 

btw, the code you've posted would certainly resolve your problem but only because every request is accompanied by a login action. Ideally we'd like to avoid sending credentials with every request and for that reason are relying on the cookie login token.

Okay so the case of https://mydomain.de with .mydomain.de for a cookiedomain is failing. Removing the '.' from the front of the cookiedomain should limit the accepted cookies to your mydomain.de host and you will then be able to specify mydomain.de in the repository settings page.  Fyi, we're using Apache HttpClient which implements rfc2109 ( http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2109/rfc2109.txt see section 4.3.2 Rejecting Cookies).
